definition: to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

sentences.english: Advanced Aeronautics booster color changes for Apollo and Carrier Drones.
sentences.chinese: 先进航空学将会改变阿波罗和舰载机的加速器颜色。

sentences.english: It's about the air wing and our Navy.
sentences.chinese: 这是舰载机联队以及我们海军的任务。

sentences.english: Carrier Drones are now able to change targets, increased speed, tweaked damage.
sentences.chinese: 舰载机现在可以切换目标，增加速度，微调伤害。

sentences.english: In this paper, the take-off path of sea-based aircraft was calculated.
sentences.chinese: 文中对舰载机的弹射起飞进行了仿真计算。

sentences.english: A general mathematical model of carrier - based aircraft ski jump take -off is derived based on tensor.
sentences.chinese: 基于张量推导建立了舰载机起飞过程的一般数学模型。

sentences.english: The fast-extension motion of the nose gear of the carrier-based aircraft is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了舰载机前起落架的突伸运动。

definition: aircraft carrier/CL:艘[sou1]/(coll.) (fig.) sth huge/(like) a whale
aircraft carrier/abbr. for 航空母艦|航空母舰[hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4]
opportunity in a battle/fighter aircraft/war secret
early warning aircraft system, e.g. US AWACS
